intro: Bikkia comptonii, commonly known as the Compton's bikkia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white, with four petals and a distinctive glandular structure. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Bikkia comptonii is adapted to arid environments and has a short growing season, typically blooming in spring.
